item.description:
The film starts at 8:15 at the MFA, but we're meeting for dinner first.

from the MFA website:

Screaming Masterpiece (GargandiI Snilld) by Ari Alexander Ergis Magnússon (2005, 87 min.). At the edge of the inhabitable North Atlantic, Icelanders have whiled away the long, dark centuries patiently honing their caustic humor, eccentric melodies, and ancient poetry. The film takes the audience behind the scenes of Reykjavik's irrepressible musical underground that fosters a unique sound and attitude, mixing ancient dirges and contemporary electronics, rock, pop, and classical influences. Screaming Masterpiece delivers the explosive music scene with massive 5.1 Dolby sound and a fast-paced visual extravaganza that leaves you breathless. We follow Björk, Sigür Rös, Müm, Mugisson, Apparat, Eivor, Johan Johansson, Bang Gang, Slow Blow, and more over a two-year period as they tour the world. The creeping glaciers, barren highland sands, and dark raging, ghost-filled seas set the backdrop for the raw energy of the music.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a meetup sign in the Boloco
item.name: More Music Mayhem: Screaming Masterpiece
